_exec_summary.SummaryText: The Kermit Compressor Station located in Mingo County, W.Va. is a Natural Gas Dewpoint Control Plant designed to process 32 MMscf of Natural Gas per day . The compression was brought on line in Sept. of 2007. The process was in place.Low pressure inlet gas enters the facility from several pipe lines and is manifoiled in to the 4 Compressor on location, The gas is then compressed up to 350 psig, send throung a TEG water removeal station and then send to a Natural Gas Dewpoint Plant where the gas is cooled and the C-3 plus Hydrocarbons are removed. The Stripped Gas is then Metered and solded to Columbea Gas Transmission. The Liquids stripped from the Natural Gas are sent from the Plant to a 30,000 Storage Tank and loaded on a Truck and sent to Mark West Hydrocarbons in Sialom, Ky. The Facility produces approx. 3000 gals. 15,000 lbs. of Hydrocarbons per day. The Hydrocarbon make up of Liquid is as follows .5% ethane, 6% propane, 8.4% Butanes, 22.6% pentanes and 58% C-6plus.The weight of the total Liquids is 150,000 lbs.                                                                                                               Worst Case and Alterinate Releas Scenarios                                                                                                                         We use RMP Comp and calcuated a mixture of fammable substance stream as. Ethane 5% @ 3.11 lbs. per gal, 4332 lbs., Propane 6% @ 4.224 lbs per gall or 6801lbs, 15% Butanes @ 4.865 lbs per gal. or 20656 lbs., Pentane 22.5% @ 5.2 lbs per gal. or 26,675 lbs., C-6 plus 52.5% @ 5.8 lbs. per gal. or 76,696 lbs.                                                                                    These factors give the total weight of the Liquids 136,168 lbs. This gave the worst case scenario (worst Case assumes the entirecontents were released and formed a vapor cloud which detonated) the distance to the overpressure endpoint of 1 psi is 0.4 miles. There are 44 homes and 260 Residents, 18 Busnes

ses and 2 Churches in the Radius of the Facility  Large Compressor Building would help proctect the people living East of the Facility.                                                                                           The Alternate release scenario involves a Pull-Away esplosion of a driver failing to removethe hose while loading. The scenario involves a release of the entire content of the hose 2"x25' or 4.1 gals.or 17 lbs. The scenario estimates a sudden release and immediate shutdown with the active mitigation system Snappy Joe Valves and Excess Flow Valves this gave us an alternate case scenario distanceto the overpressure endpoint of 1 psi of 0,2 miles. The are 14 residences and 4 busnesses in this scenario.                                                                                                                                                                          Five Year Accident History                                                                                                                                              Greystar has operated the Facility since May 2008, we have helped man the starion since 10/06. There have been no accidents in these time frames.                                                                                                                                                       Accidential Release Prevention Program                                                                                                                             The Kemit Compressor Station is subject to OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 Process Safety Management for Highly Haqardous Chemicals (PSM). The PSM Program is being implemented at this time.                                                                               The Kermit Compressor Station is covered by the CHK ISO-140001 Environmental Management System certificate.                 The Kermit Compressor Station is also subject to the EPA's 40 CFR112.7 Spill prvention Count

ermeasures and Control standard. An SPCC is in place to establish procedures to prevent, contain and control a Hydroccarbon Release.                        The Kermit Compressor Station complies with NFPA 58 Standards.                                                                                         In the event of a fire at the Kermit Compressor Station employees may respond to an incipient stge fire and the must evacuate, and then evacuate the facility. An Emergency Action Plan developed to 29 CFR 1910.36 (A) is in plsace to establish the save evacuation of the facility and summon emergency response organizations.                                                                              The Kermit Fire Dept coordinated response with Kermit Compressor Station. They have visited the Facility.
